description: The 'draw_divide_into_equal_groups' function generates a visual representation of a given number of dots divided into equal groups. This function is designed to help students understand the concept of division as equal grouping, a fundamental concept in arithmetic.
example_usage:
# Example usage for draw_divide_into_equal_groups
result = draw_divide_into_equal_groups(data)

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Division as Equal Grouping
stimulus_type_specification.description: The images generated by this function visually represent the concept of division as equal grouping. Each image contains a specified number of groups, each with the same number of dots. The groups are represented as large circles, and the dots as smaller circles within the larger ones. These images help students understand that division involves splitting a quantity into equal parts. The number of groups and the number of dots per group are customizable, allowing educators to tailor the difficulty level to the needs of their students.

details: Small circles (dots) within the large circles representing individual units
Equal number of dots in each group
Randomly chosen color for the dots

stimulus_type_specification.educational_purpose: The visualization aids in solidifying the concept of division as equal grouping. By seeing the groups and the dots within them, students can understand how a total quantity can be divided into equal parts. This is particularly useful for students who are visual learners. Furthermore, the ability to customize the number of groups and dots allows educators to progressively increase the complexity as students become more comfortable with the concept.

educational_standards.description: Write a multiplication equation that represents an equal sets of objects.
Write a division equation that represents an equal sets of objects.

educational_standards.display_name: Find the Missing Factors up to Ten
educational_standards.description: Find a missing factor for a multiplication fact.
